subclassFeatures.name: College of Metal
entries: They say those who follow the College of Metal follow a dark and fiendish path. They are mistaken. For the College of Metal is one that channels the power of one's loudest emotions to their ends. With their high tempo and thunderous music they fire up their allies and devastate enemies. Through their techniques these musical warriors turn sound into their weapon.

entries.name: Percussive Attacker
entries: At 3rd level, you learn the {@spell booming blade|scag} cantrip. This cantrip is a bard spell for you.
When creatures add your Bardic Inspiration die to an attack roll the attack deals bonus thunder damage equal to the roll on the Bardic Inspiration die.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with medium armor, shields, and martial weapons if you do not already have it.

entries.name: Amplified Shout
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you deal thunder damage you can use your bonus action to sing out a phrase from a song or belt out a series of notes on your instrument. Creatures you choose within 10 feet of you must make a Constitution save. Targets take {@dice 6d6} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You can also choose a number of creatures other than yourself in the area up to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1) to give Bardic Inspiration die to, expending a use of Bardic Inspiration per creature. Once you use this feature you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Battle Magic
entries: At 14th level, when you use your action to a cast a bard spell, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: At 3rd level you gain proficiency with the {@skill Performance} skill.

entries.name: War Dancing
entries: At 3rd level, you can begin a War Dance on your turn as a bonus action. When you do so, choose a number of allied creatures that you can see and that can see you, up to a number equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one) to join your War Dance. The War Dance lasts for 1 minute and allows you to expend an inspiration die to use one of the following dance phrases as a bonus action. Creatures taking part in your War Dance must be able to see you to benefit from a dance phrase.

items: {@b Places People!:} Creatures taking part in your War Dance may immediately use their reactions to move up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

{@b Slide:} Roll your bardic inspiration die. A creature you choose that is joined in your war dance gains a bonus to their AC equal to the roll on the Bardic Inspiration die until the start of your next turn.
{@b Light feet:} Creatures joined in your war dance can take the dash action as a bonus action until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Rhythm Ramp-up
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can select a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Creatures taking part in your War Dance that attack your selected creature gain a bonus to the damage rolls for their next attack until the start of your next turn. The damage bonus starts at +1 and increases by 1 for each other creature joined in your War Dance that hits with an attack. Once you have used this feature you can not use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Dancer's Challenge
entries: Starting at 14th level a creature you can see within 60 feet must make a Charisma saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you. While {@condition charmed} this way the creature is compelled to dance, using all its movement dancing in its space. A flying creature without the ability to hover circles as few spaces as possible. You must use an action on your turn to dance to maintain the charm. The creature may use an action on its turn to make a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check contested by your Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check to escape the compelled dance before it uses all of its movement that turn.

subclassFeatures.name: Path of the Clenched Fist
entries: Those that follow the Path of the Closed Fist have chosen to bring about their will with their own two hands. They are the ultimate masters of close quarters combat, armed or unarmed. They impose their will upon the battlefield, grabbing their foes and placing them where they wish. Many that follow this path believe that you only have a right to what you can keep from your enemies. A foe that can not escape their grip to fight weaker targets does not deserve to do so. In overcoming an obstacle these barbarians prove to themselves they are just and right.

entries.name: Martial Arts Die
entries: At 3rd level you can roll a d4 in place of your unarmed strike or natural weapon damage. When you make an attack with an unarmed strike or natural weapon you can make another attack with an unarmed strike or natural weapon as a bonus action. Your Martial Arts Die increases as you level. See the "Martial Arts" column in Table: Path of the Clenched Fist.

entries.name: Athletic Expert
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check you can add double your proficiency bonus. This bonus does not apply if you already add double your proficiency bonus from another feature.

entries.name: The Irresistible Fist
entries: Starting at 6th level, your unarmed strikes and natural weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to non-magical attacks and damage.

entries.name: Living Flail
entries: At 10th level, you swing around your {@condition grappled} targets and smash them against walls, the ground, and other foes. When you have grappled a creature you may swing them like a flail. You may use any creatures you have grappled as a one-handed melee bludgeoning weapon that you are proficient in as long as you maintain the grapple. The weapon uses your Martial Arts die for damage rolls. When you hit with this weapon the grappled creature also takes damage as if the attack hit them as well. Use the same damage roll when calculating this damage.

entries.name: Reversal
entries: At 14th level, when a creature within 5 feet of you attacks you and misses you can use your reaction to attempt to grapple or shove that creature. When a creature attempts to grapple you and you win the contest you can use your reaction to cause that creature to become {@condition grappled} by you. When a creature attempts to shove you and you win the contest you may use your reaction to shove that creature.

subclassFeatures.name: Circle of Symbiosis
entries: The Circle of Symbiosis looked inward and found that each of us is an ecosystem full of life. By connecting with and strengthening their relationship with the many small living things inside them they strengthen their bodies to make themselves iron hearted protectors of nature.

entries.name: Symbiotic Transformation
entries: At 2nd level, when you use cast a Druid spell you can expend a use of Wild Shape to have the microflora and microfauna you host in your body symbiotically transform you instead of taking on a beast form as a bonus action. When you do so you gain 3 temporary hit points per druid level. The transformation lasts for 1 hour or until you expend a use of Wild Shape.

entries.name: Symbiotic Bonus Dice
entries: You have a symbiotic bonus die which is {@dice 1d6}. While you are symbiotically transformed your melee weapon attacks deal an extra {@dice 1d6} radiant or necrotic damage (you choose when you use Symbiotic Transformation). The number of dice increases at certain levels in this class shown in the Table: Symbiotic Bonus Dice.

entries.name: Grow Armor
entries: When you symbiotically transform you can come under the effects of {@spell barkskin} for the duration.

entries.name: Symbiotic Spread
entries: At 10th level, when you gain temporary hit points from your Symbiotic Transformation you can send a colony of the symbiotic life you host to grant a creature within 5 feet of you the same number of temporary hit points for 1 hour.

entries.name: Symbiotic Adaptation
entries: At 14th level, you become immune to poison damage, the {@condition poisoned} condition, and disease. You can not be {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}. The symbiotic life you host allow you to become self sustaining. You can replace your need for food by exposing yourself to bright light for 4 hours in a day. The time need not be consecutive. You still need water as normal.

subclassFeatures.name: Duelist
entries: An old question. Is it better to be quick or is it better to be heavily armored? Duelists say the former. Fighting on the edge of a knife, barely ducking under an axe, then swiftly but narrowly laying their foe open. Then on to the next duel.

entries.name: Critical Contender
entries: At 3rd level, your melee weapon attacks with weapons without the heavy property score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20.

entries.name: Preemptive Attack
entries: At 3rd level, while you are not wearing heavy armor, when a creature is about to make a melee attack against you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature before determining if their attack hits or misses.

entries.name: Avoidance
entries: At 7th level, you can take the Dodge action as a bonus action while you are not wearing heavy armor. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Strength or your Dexterity modifier. You regain expended uses after finishing a short rest.

entries.name: Improved Critical Contender
entries: At 10th level, your melee weapon attacks with weapons without the heavy property score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

entries.name: Devastating Critical
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you score a critical hit with a weapon attack, you gain a bonus to that weapon's damage roll equal to your level in this class.

entries.name: Live and Die by the Sword
entries: At 18th level, when you have half your maximum hit points or less you can make a melee weapon attack with a weapon without the heavy property with advantage once per turn. Also you can use the Preemptive Attack feature once a turn without expending your reaction.

subclassFeatures.name: Way of the Hurler
entries: Hurlers practice a style of combat using thrown weapons. While other styles apply ki through a direct pathway of body to limb to weapon to target, hurlers let their ki empower their weapons and make them an extension of themselves. In doing so, they are able to perform seemingly impossible throwing maneuvers appearing as a storm of blades flying out at targets.

entries.name: Flurry of Blades
entries: At 3rd level, immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 1 ki point to make two ranged weapon attacks with weapons that have the thrown property as a bonus action.

entries.name: Thrower Technique
entries: At 3rd level, when you make a thrown weapon attack you can draw another weapon with the thrown property.
Whenever you hit a creature with one of the attacks granted by Flurry of Blades, you can use one of the following techniques on the target:

items: You can pin it to a vertical solid surface within 5 feet of the target. When you do so the creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your ki save DC or have its speed reduced to 0. The creature can use an action on its turn to free itself. Another creature within 5 feet can use their action to free them as well.

If you hit with the first bonus action attack granted by flurry of blades, you twirl your weapons to distract the creature you just hit. The next ranged weapon attack with a weapon with the thrown property you make against that creature before the end of your next turn has advantage.
Your projectile bounces off its original target to strike another within 10 feet of your original target and takes damage equal to your Strength or Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Returning Strike
entries: At 6th level, you can use your action spend 1 ki point to throw a thrown weapon in a 30 foot line, up to its range. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Ki save DC or take damage equal to your martial arts die + your Dexterity or Strength modifier. You then mentally command the weapon to magically fly back to your hand, forcing creatures in the line to repeat the saving throw or take the same damage again.

entries.name: Thrown Volley
entries: At 11th level, you can use your action to make a thrown weapon attack against any number of creatures within 10 feet of a point you can see within your weapon's range. You must have a weapon for each target, as normal, and you make a separate attack roll for each target. When you hit with these attacks you may spend 1 ki point to per attack to apply one of your techniques from the Thrower Technique feature.

entries.name: Hail of Blades
entries: At 17th level, you can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell conjure volley} with a thrown weapon instead of ammunition as the material component.

subclassFeatures.name: Oath of Hope
entries: To take the Oath of Hope is to be a pillar of strength for others to draw on. As a divine servant of good you replace despair with hope.

entries.name: Be an example
entries: If you expect others to do the right thing then you should show them.

entries.name: Boundless enthusiasm
entries: Overcome despair.

entries.name: Uplift your fellows
entries: Bring hope to others and leave no room for gloom.

entries.name: Aim high
entries: Believe in your strength and shatter expectations.

entries.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of Hope Spells
rows: {@spell beacon of hope}, {@spell mass healing word}
{@spell rary's telepathic bond}, {@spell circle of power}

entries.name: Channel Divinity: Follow Example
entries: As a bonus action, creatures you choose within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you are urged by your actions to act with alacrity for 1 minute. When you make an attack roll, one of the creatures you chose can use their reaction to make a ranged or melee weapon attack.

entries.name: Channel Divinity: Guided Strike
entries: When you make an attack roll, you can use your Channel Divinity to gain a +10 bonus to the roll. You make this choice after you see the roll, but before the DM says whether the attack hits or misses.

entries.name: Aura of Excellence
entries: Starting at 7th level, creatures you choose within 10 feet of you gain the following benefit: When a creature within your aura (including yourself) misses with an attack roll or fails a saving throw you can use your reaction to roll again, possibly changing the result.
The range of this aura increases to 30 feet at 18th level.

entries.name: Rise Again
entries: Starting at 15th level, when a creature within your Aura of Excellence is reduced to 0 hit points and not killed outright, you can choose to have them drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this ability on a creature, you can't use it again on that creature until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Symbol of Hope
entries: Starting at 20th level you can use your action to undergo a transformation that lasts for 1 minute and grants the following benefits:

items: Creatures you choose within 30 feet of you are immune to being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.
When you hit a creature with an attack your allies follow your example. The next attack one of your allies makes against that creature before the start of your next turn has advantage.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Leviathan Hunter
entries: It takes a special breed of individual to stand on unstable ships and throw spears at many limbed sea beasts, to try and net the ancient aboleth, or dive after the mighty dragon turtle. Leviathan Hunters are that breed of person. They have refined the use of nets to capture prey before executing them.

entries.name: Seaworthy
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a swim speed equal to your walking speed. You gain proficiency in {@item weaver's tools|phb}. You can make a net by spending 5 silver pieces on materials and weaving for an hour using weaver's tools. This can be done as part of a short rest. The DM might allow you to improvise the tools and material needed to create a net.

entries.name: Leviathan Catcher
entries: At 3rd level, you become a skilled user of {@item net|phb|nets}, gaining the following benefits:

items: When attacking with a net you do not have disadvantage from using a net at long range and you do not have disadvantage from using a ranged weapon within 5 feet of a target.
Nets have the finesse property for you.
Making an attack with a net does not restrict your ability to make other attacks.
You can attack with a net as a bonus action.
Your weapon attacks against creatures restrained by a net deal an extra {@dice 1d6} of the weapon's damage.

entries.name: Steel Will
entries: At 7th level, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.

entries.name: Improved Leviathan Catcher
entries: At 11th level, your skill at weaving {@item net|phb|nets} improves:

items: Nets you make have have a Strength DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier to break out of.
Nets you make have an AC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.
Nets you make have temporary hit points equal to your ranger level.
Nets you make an be used to {@condition restrained|phb|restrain} huge creatures.

entries.name: Bring ‘em Down!
entries: At 15th level, when creature within your reach misses you with an attack you trip them over as you duck under the strike. You can use your reaction to attempt to shove the creature. This feature can be used to shove a creature up to two size categories larger than you.

Leviathan Hunters are that breed of person. They have refined the use of nets to capture prey before executing them.

items: When attacking with a net you do not have disadvantage from using a net at long range and you do not have disadvantage from using a ranged weapon within 5 feet of a target.
Nets have the finesse property for you.
Making an attack with a net does not restrict your ability to make other attacks.
You can attack with a net as a bonus action.
Your weapon attacks against creatures restrained by a net deal an extra {@dice 1d6} of the weapon's damage.

entries.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

entries.name: Steel Will
entries: At 7th level, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.

items: Nets you make have have a Strength DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier to break out of.
Nets you make have an AC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.
Nets you make have temporary hit points equal to your ranger level.
Nets you make an be used to {@condition retrained|restrain} huge creatures.

entries.name: Bring ‘em Down!
entries: At 15th level, when creature within your reach misses you with an attack you trip them over as you duck under the strike. You can use your reaction to attempt to shove the creature. This feature can be used to shove a creature up to two size categories larger than you.

subclassFeatures.name: Arcane Sniper
entries: The Arcane Sniper strikes down their targets from stealth with bolts of energy rather than arrows or blades. Whether sniping from afar, or spying on foes the Arcane Sniper's skills will get the job done. The practice of arcane sniping evolved during the Last War as magewright soldiers explored ambush tactics.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you gain the ability to cast spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 for the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn three cantrips from the wizard spell list: You learn {@spell fire bolt}, a cantrip with a spell attack roll and 1 other cantrip of your choice. If you already know fire bolt you may select another cantrip from the wizard spell list instead. At 10th level you learn another cantrip from the wizard spell list.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Arcane Sniper Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
You start with two 1st-level spell slots at Rogue level 3, and gain more as you gain more Rogue levels.

entries.name: Spells Known
entries: You know three 1st-level wizard spells of your choice, two of which must be evocation or illusion spells.

The Spells Known column in Table: Arcane Sniper Spellcasting shows when you learn more wizard spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be an evocation or illusion spell of your choice, and must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the wizard spells you know with another spell of your choice from the wizard spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it must be an evocation or illusion spell, unless you're replacing the spell you gained at 8th, 14th, or 20th level.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your wizard spells. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a wizard spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Arcane Sniping
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to sneak attack with cantrips with ranged spell attack rolls that deal damage instead of with a finesse or ranged weapon. The sneak attack dice deal the same damage as the spell. If the spell deals more than one type of damage then you choose one of them for the sneak attack dice. When you sneak attack this way the cantrip deals damage as if cast by a 1st level character.

entries.name: Stealthy Spellcasting
entries: At 9th level, you gain the ability cast a spell and ignore its verbal and somatic components a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier. You regain all expended uses after finishing a long rest.

entries.name: Cover Fire
entries: At 13th level, if you hit a creature with a ranged spell attack you can choose an ally within 60 feet of the creature. That creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against that ally until the end of the ally's next turn.

entries.name: Arcane Sniping Master
entries: At 17th level, you can sneak attack with a spell of 1st level or higher that has a spell attack roll instead of with a finesse or ranged weapon. Once you use this feature you can't use it again until you finish a short rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Elemental Earth Bloodline
entries: You claim ancestry with a dao or other powerful being of Elemental Earth. Your birth might have been marked by tremors or even a Terran

entries.name: Earth Magic
entries: The following spells may be learned by you when you learn new sorcerer spells starting at the indicated sorcerer level. These spells count as sorcerer spells for you.

rows: {@spell meld into stone}, {@spell wall of sand|XGE}
{@spell bones of the earth|XGE}, {@spell flesh to stone}

entries.name: Wait and Listen
entries: Starting at 6th level, you gain tremorsense out to 60 feet. When a creature you can detect with tremorsense misses you with an attack or you succeed a save against a spell, you can use your reaction to send a shockwave through the earth at the attacker or caster. A magical bludgeon of earth emerges from the ground and strikes the target. The target takes bludgeoning damage equal to half your sorcerer level + your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Burrower
entries: Starting at 14th level you can move through earth like a fish swims through water. You gain a burrow speed equal to your walking speed. You can burrow through solid rock at half your burrow speed. The tunnel you leave behind is as wide as you are. Using a bonus action you can will the tunnels you dig to collapse behind you on your turn. You may not collapse a pre-existing tunnel, even one made by you on other turns.

entries.name: Earthkin
entries: At 18th level you unlock the traits of your elemental bloodline:

items: You no longer need to eat or breathe.
When you are not burrowing through rock you can choose to not disturb the material you move through.
You are immune to the {@condition petrified} condition.
You are immune to poison.

subclassFeatures.name: The Great Tree
entries: You have made a pact with an exceptionally old Treant, Dryad or other arboreal being. Your patron might be Pando, a Dryad whose bonded tree is a forest of quaking aspens connected by a single root system. It could be the Tree of Life, with sprawling roots acting as the foundation of an ecosystem.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

rows: {@spell spike growth}, {@spell locate animals or plants}

entries.name: Bonus Language
entries: At 1st level you learn Sylvan.

entries.name: Livewood Branch
entries: At 1st level your patron bestows upon you a {@item quarterstaff|phb} made of livewood which you can use as a focus for your Warlock spells. The wood remains eternally green and alive. While you wield this staff you can cast a {@filter Druid cantrip|spells|level=0|class=druid} chosen when you get this feature. You can't be disarmed of the quarterstaff unless you are {@condition incapacitated}. If it is on the same plane of existence, you can summon the quarterstaff weapon as a bonus action on your turn, causing it to teleport instantly to your hand. Should your livewood quarterstaff be destroyed you can perform a 1 hour ritual to be granted another by your patron.

entries.name: Bramble Barrier
entries: At 6th level while you are wielding your livewood quarterstaff you can cause it to sprout a protective barrier. When you are the target of an attack roll you can use your reaction to cause the livewood staff to sprout a magical thicket of thorns around you to protect you. The thicket forms a sphere of total cover around you. If the attacker made a melee attack within 5 feet of you they take {@dice 2d10} piercing damage. The thicket has hit points equal to your Warlock level + your Charisma modifier. Any creature that hits the thicket with a melee attack takes {@dice 2d10} piercing damage. At the start of your next turn the thicket recedes back into the staff. You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Tree Traits
entries: At 10th level you gain resistance to non-magical bludgeoning and piercing damage. In addition, you age at a slower rate. For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year, and you are immune to being magically aged.

entries.name: Arboreal Ally
entries: At 14th level your livewood quarterstaff can act as a vessel for a forest guardian's spirit. As an action you can plant down your livewood staff within 5 feet of you and have it either transform into a {@creature Dryad} or an {@creature Awakened Tree} for 1 minute. The creature is friendly to you and will obey commands you give it. The Dryad or Awakened Tree has temporary hit points equal to your Warlock level when summoned. The Dryad or Awakened Tree use your Warlock spell save DC in place of their own for spells and abilities. The Dryad or Awakened Tree transforms back into your livewood quarterstaff if reduced to 0 hit points or after 1 {@homebrew minute|hour}. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Augmented Familiar Tradition
entries: Pairings of martials and mages are well known in the stories of Eberron. The Tradition of the Augmented Familiar is chosen by those who wish to bring their own muscle into battle. By using magic to enhance their familiar's abilities they are never without a loyal ally and friend.

entries.name: Creature Savant
entries: At 2nd level, the gold and time you must spend to copy a spell that creates or summons a creature into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Combat Familiar
entries: Starting at 2nd level, add the {@spell find familiar} spell to your spellbook if you don't already have it. Your familiar summoned by find familiar gains the following benefits:

items: Your familiar's natural weapons deal {@dice 1d6} damage.

Your familiar can attack in combat and gains a bonus on damage rolls equal to your proficiency bonus, unless they have taken on a form not listed in the {@spell find familiar} spell, such as being affected by the {@spell polymorph} spell.
Your familiar's proficiency bonus is now equal to your proficiency bonus.
Your familiar can use their Dexterity modifier or Strength modifier for their attack and damage rolls with the attacks listed in their stats.
While within 30 feet of your familiar when you cast a spell that can only target one creature on yourself you can choose to have the spell also affect your familiar.
Your familiar's hit dice are now d6s. Your familiar has a number of hit dice equal to your wizard level. Your familiar has maximum possible hit points from their first hit dice.
Your familiar's challenge rating equals your wizard level for the purposes of spell effects.

entries.name: Magic-empowered strikes
entries: At 6th level, your familiar's natural weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance or immunity to non-magical weapons.

entries.name: Morphable Familiar
entries: At 6th level, your familiar can use a bonus action to transform into a different animal form listed in {@spell find familiar}.

entries.name: Cantrip Echo
entries: At 10th level when you cast a wizard cantrip your familiar can cast that cantrip on their next turn. The familiar's spell attack bonus is your proficiency modifier + your intelligence modifier and their spell save DC is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your intelligence modifier. Your familiar casts the cantrip as if a creature of 1st level.

entries.name: Delegate Concentration
entries: Starting at 14th level, when you cast a spell that requires concentration you can choose to have your familiar concentrate for you if they are within 100 feet of you. When you do so you can not cast another spell that requires concentration without causing your familiar to stop concentrating. Your familiar otherwise follows the normal rules for concentration.

subclassFeatures.name: Prophecy Domain
entries: Once the dragons of the Chamber employed agents that drew power from the Draconic Prophecy as a divine force itself. They acted throughout the Last War to prevent the Lords of Dust from freeing the Overlords. Their subtle works went unsung and as the Last War came to a close the need for the clerics of the Draconic Prophecy faded, and so did the agents. Now as the new millennium approaches Khorvaire has become a powder keg that could explode into war again. The need for such clerics is suddenly renewed. Now the Lords of Dust have also raised their own clerics of the Prophecy. Some clerics of the Draconic Prophecy consider themselves servants of fate, while others think of themselves as the directors of fate.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Prophecy Domain Spells
rows: {@spell rary's telepathic bond}, {@spell contact other plane}

entries.name: Omens of Danger
entries: At 1st level, through your daily life you take note of omens that foretell of danger to you, allowing you to brace yourself. When making a Dexterity saving throw or when you are the target of an attack roll you can use your reaction to take the Dodge action. You can this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Channel Divinity: Foretold Cascade
entries: At 2nd level, with a small ripple you set into motion a series of events that moves towards a favorable future. When you roll damage for a cleric spell roll another die for each die that landed on its maximum value. If any of the new dice land on their maximum value you can roll another dice for each of those, continuing the cycle until no more dice land on their maximum value.

entries.name: Foreseen Fortune
entries: At 6th level, you can subtly guide the future down certain paths of the Prophecy. On your turn you can grant yourself or an ally within 60 feet of you the ability to apply advantage to an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw within 1 minute, after the player has seen the roll, but before the DM has announced the result. To use this feature roll 1d6 on the Table: Foreseen Fortune. The result describes requirement you must meet using your item interaction before you can grant advantage. Once you use this feature you can not use it again until you finish a short rest. If you can not fulfill the requirement the use is not wasted.

entries.caption: Foreseen Fortune
rows: Take out (if not on hand) and blow a feather.
Break a small object, like a stick or maybe a clay vase.
Take out a liquid container (if not on hand) and pour a drop of liquid on the floor.
Take out (if not on hand) and drop a ball bearing, allowing it to roll.
Kick a piece of debris, such as a small stone.

entries: NOTE to Dungeon Masters: The requirements for Foreseen Fortune are meant to be evocative and spark your imagination as to how fulfilling the requirement results in advantage. Perhaps some unusual domino effect results in the advantage being granted, or maybe fulfilling the requirement invisibly alters the threads of fate. One thing the requirements should not be, is difficult to accomplish. If you find the requirements are too often unfulfillable in your campaign then you can construct your own table of item interactions.

entries.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

entries.name: Tools of Divination
entries: At 17th level, you can add 4 {@filter divination spells|spells|school=D} from any spell list to your domain spells. Like your other domain spells they are always prepared for you.
